chrome.notes: The onanimationcancel property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('animationcancel', function() {});. See bug 868224.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 19, click() is only defined on buttons and inputs.

chrome_android.notes: Before Chrome 19, click() is only defined on buttons and inputs.

notes: Before Firefox 5, click() is only defined on buttons and inputs, and has no effect on text and file inputs.
Starting in Firefox 75, the click() function works even when the element is not attached to a DOM tree.
Before Firefox 5, click() is only defined on buttons and inputs, and has no effect on text and file inputs.
Starting in Firefox for Android 79, the click() function works even when the element is not attached to a DOM tree.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Before Samsung Internet 1.5, click() is only defined on buttons and inputs.

webview_android.notes: Before Android WebView 4.4, click() is only defined on buttons and inputs.

safari.notes: The property is defined only for its useful elements: <link>, <script>, and <style>; it is undefined for all other elements.

safari_ios.notes: The property is defined only for its useful elements: <link>, <script>, and <style>; it is undefined for all other elements.

ie.notes: Before Internet Explorer 9, this event is not supported via addEventListener.
Before Internet Explorer 9, this event is not supported via addEventListener.
Before Internet Explorer 9, this event is not supported via addEventListener.

edge.notes: Returns incorrect value for elements without an explicit tabindex attribute. See issue 4365703 for details.

ie.notes: Returns incorrect value for elements without an explicit tabindex attribute. See issue 4365703 for details.
